In a large pot, saute the onion in oil over medium-high heat until the onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and thyme. Cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Add the drained beans, bay leaves and enough water to cover beans. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce temperature to simmer, cover and cook for 40 to 50 minutes or until beans are tender but not mushy. Check often and add from 1 to 2 cups additional water if beans start to cook dry. Drain beans, remove the bay leaves and fresh thyme springs, season with salt and pepper to taste. Please. If they are salted before they will not soften. When cool, divide into 1 cup servings and freeze in rigid container or vacuum pack in small bags.

Melt margarine in large non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Turn off flame. Stir in extracts. Fold in cereal and continue folding until well coated. Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray and press mixture into pan. Cool and cut into squares.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place cubed chicken in a ungreased rectangular baking dish, 13 x 9 x 2 inches. Bake chicken for 25-30 minutes, cook thoroughly. Meanwhile, start cooking your rice according to your package directions. Then in a large bowl, add the remaining ingredients and still well. When the chicken is done remove it from oven. Spoon in the ingredients from the bowl. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve hot over rice and be sure to get lots of the juice.

Mix cream cheese, sour cream, apple, blue cheese, red onion, pecans, triscuit crackers. Bake on a greased cookie sheet for 10 minutes then allow to cool completely. In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, sour cream, apple, blue cheese, red onion, pecans, triscuit crackers. In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, sour cream,

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar. Stir the eggs, applesauce and mashed bananas into the butter mixture until well blended. Stir the banana mixture into flour mixture just to moisten. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake in a preheated oven for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of loaf comes out clean. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes and then turn out onto a wire rack to cool.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine rice, broth, salt, butter, yellow onion, fresh parsley. Bring to a boil. Decrease heat to low and cook, covered, until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Meanwhile, in a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add in onion. Saute about 5 minutes, until tender. Stir sauteed onions into cooked rice. Add in parsley and fluff with a fork before serving.

Preheat oven to 400. Cover a glass baking dish with aluminum foil and place the chicken breasts on top. Zest all 3 of the lemons into a small bowl, and then add the juice of 2 of the lemons. Add the pepper and all the other ingredients into the bowl. Mix the combine and pour over all the chicken breasts. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and drizzle with the lemon juice of the last lemon, and a few more grinds from pepper mill.

In a medium bowl, mix together sea scallops, ground cumin, chili powder, black pepper, olive oil, whole grain rice, cilantro, tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, lime. Place in rice cooker. Boil water. Add sea scallops, ground cumin, chili powder, black pepper, olive oil, whole grain rice, cilantro, tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, lime. Add scallops, ground cumin, chili powder, black pepper, olive oil, whole grain rice, cilantro, tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, lime. Add scallops, ground cumin, chili powder, black pepper, olive oil, whole

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. I prefer to use a mixing spoon over an electric mixer since the dough will be very stiff. On an ungreased cookie sheet, shape dough into round balls and then slightly press the dough down with the bottom of a cup. Bake for 8-9 minutes. Allow to cool and remove from cookie sheet. Makes around 24 cookies. Once cooled, frost with a buttercream frosting. Store in a sealed container.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Stir in corn syrup and egg whites until throughly blended. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 1 inch apart onto prepared sheets. Bake 7 to 9 minutes, or until set. Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Beat cream cheese at medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Mix in sugar. Add eggs one at a time, making sure the mixture is well blended. Stir in vanilla. Line 12 muffin cups with muffin paper, and place a chocolate wafer in each lined cup. Spoon the cream cheese mixture over the wafers. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove muffin tin from oven, but leave the cakes in the muffin pan and refrigerate them overnight. Remove the cheesecakes from the muffin pan. To serve, spoon a tablespoon of cherry pie filling on each mini cheesecake.

To make sour sirloin, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. To store, refrigerate up to 2 months. In a glass, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Beat with electric mixer until light and very fluffy. Turn into 1 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees f. In the oven for 20 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned.

In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and salt, blending well. Slowly add milk, stirring constantly. Cook until mixture boils and thickens. Set aside press tomatoes through a sieve or blend until smooth. In a soup pot, combine remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer 10 minutes. Pour white sauce into soup, stirring constantly. Heat thoroughly before serving.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place chicken breast on bottom of 9x13 baking pan. Pour soup mix over top. Bake covered for 30 minutes. Uncover bake an additional 5 to 10 minutes.

In dutch oven or electric skillet, heat oil. Add onion, saute 2 min, add beef, cook and stir until done. Add flour, cook and stir 1 minute. Add milk, butter and spices, stir until creamy. Fold in macaroni. Top with cheese, cover and heat until cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place flounder fillets in a greased shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, and salt. Spread over fillets. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 20-25 minutes or until fillets flake easily with a fork.

In a mixing bowl, beat together all ingredients except tomatoes, then add the sun-dried toimatoes. Mix with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating until creamy. Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 3 days covered. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. And grease a 8 inch square baking pan. Sift the cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt together. In a seperate bowl mix the egg, buttermilk oil and honey. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients. Beat until smooth. Pour into pan. Bake 20 minutes edges may start to brown a little.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In a large bowl, mix together maple oil, paprika, ground cinnamon, sweet potatoes, salt, brown sugar. Toss the potato strips into mixture, to coat well, and spread onto baking sheet in a single layer. Sprinkle with salt and brown sugar. Bake for 30 minutes, turning every 10 minutes.

Heat oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add garlic and stir for around 5 minutes until golden, but not burned or bitter. Remove pan from heat, let cool. Place tomatoes and basil in serving bowl, pour cooled oil and garlic over. Toss well.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In 2 pans place tomato halves cut side up. Sprinkle with oil, salt and pepper, onion, garlic, and herbs. Bake tomatoes for 2 hours. Check the tomatoes after 1 hour and turn down the heat if they seem to be cooking too quickly. Then turn the oven to 400 degrees and bake another 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and process tomatoes through a food mill using a medium dye over a small saucepan. Discard skins. Add wine, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. Cream the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract. Once combined, slowly blend in the dry ingredients until evenly mixed. Searate dough into tablespoon-sized balls. Place onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Let the cookies sit for 2 minutes before cooling on wire racks.

Preheat oven 350 degrees. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.

In a medium sized glass bowl mix together the tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, onion, garlic, sugar, salt and pepper. Combine well. Add in the juice. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving. Serve with fresh tortilla chips.

Combine sandwich bread, eggs, mustard, mayonnaise, cornichons, paprika, vinegar, salt and pepper, butter in small bowl. Place sandwich bread, eggs, mustard, mayonnaise, cornichons, paprika, vinegar, salt and pepper, butter in small bowl. Place sandwich bread, eggs, mustard, mayonnaise, cornichons, paprika,
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, whisking together well with a whisk. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Bake in oven for 1 hour. Bake in

Heat the oil in a heavy 4-quart saucepan over med-high heat. Add in the onion, carrots, and celery. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables begin to soften, 2-3 minutes. Add in the split peas, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Partially cover pan, decrease heat to med-low, and simmer until the soup is thick, about 45 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. You can add fresh herbs. Fresh dill is recommended. Also can add meat and ham bones to make it richer.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk the oil, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, ground coriander, black pepper, chickpeas and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 200d celsius lightly grease 4 ramekins and place on a baking tray. Heat a medium sized fry pan over a moderate heat and add the oil to the pan, then add the spinach and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the leaves are just softened. Drain the spinach in a colander and as soon as spinach is cool enough to handle, squeeze out excess liquid. Divide the spinach between the ramekins and break two eggs on top of the spinach. Pour one tablespoon of cream over the eggs and sprinkle with one tablespoon of parmesan. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the eggs are set and puffed up. Serve immediately with toast.

Combine all ingredients except pasta in small sauce pan. Cook on high heat until bubbly, stirring often. Turn down heat and cover. Simmer at least 30 minutes for best flavor. Cook pasta according to package directions. Sauce may be thinned with water reserved from pasta if desired. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x9-inch cake pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, cream butter and splenda. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, salt. Add dry ingredients to wet, mix well to combine. Add milk and walnuts, stirring until just combined. Spread half of mixture into prepared cake pan. Spread half of pie filling over top. Spread remaining batter carefully over apples and arrange remaining apple pie filling over top. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Place cake pan on a wire rack and let set for at least 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter a 2-quart casserole dish. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except the grated cheddar cheese. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, top with grated cheddar, bake for 5 minutes longer. If desired, roasted garlic may be added to mixture.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, milk & butter. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 238. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. With a wooden spoon, beat until thick and creamy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a buttered 8-inch square dish. Cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 400c line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix. The dough is quite stiff and crumbly, but you should still be able to form it into balls that stick together. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place on the cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until golden. Allow to cool on the cookie sheet for a while and then transfer carefully on a wire rack to cool completely. Dust warm cookies with powdered sugar.

Combine flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, mash the banana and add the soy milk and peanut butter. Combine flour mixture and peanut butter mixture. Let batter sit for 5 minutes while spraying the griddle and heating it. Pour 3 inch pancakes and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Serve with maple syrup, fruit spread, bananas, etc.

In a large, deep skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the broccoli, cut side down, cover and cook over moderate heat until richly browned on the bottom, about 8 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil along with the garlic and the crushed red pepper and cook uncovered until the garlic is golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil along with the garlic and the crushed red pepper and cook uncovered until the garlic is golden

In a small bowl, combine the coconut oil, head cauliflower, white onion, garlic, water, salt, white pepper, parsley and mix well. Add the coconut oil, head cauliflower, white onion, garlic, water, salt, white pepper, parsley and mix well. Add the coconut oil, head cauliflower, white onion, garlic, water, salt, white pepper,

Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Process cookies in food processor until finely ground. Combine crumbs, butter, salt, vanilla and almonds, stirring until crumbs are moistened. Press mixture evenly across 9-inch pie plate. Bake crust until crisp, about 7 minutes. Let cool completely before filling. Crust may also be wrapped tightly in plastic and frozen up to one month.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix oil, and seasonings in a large bowl. Add chicken and potatoes. Toss to coat. Arrange chicken and potatoes in single layer in pan. Roast in oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Combine the cocoa, salt, and flour together. Stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake at 375, for 12-15 minutes.
Slice egg in half lengthwise and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 10-15 minute.

Place the olive oil in a large skillet over low heat. Add the tomatoes, garlic, half of the pinenuts, rocket and basil in a food processor and process until smooth. Toast the remaining pinenuts until golden. Set aside. Slowly add the oil to the olive oil while the processor is running. Turn the processor off and then stir through the parmesan. Stir pesto through the pasta then sprinkle with the reserved pinenuts. Serve immediately with salad and crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Heat the butter in a large pan over low heat. Add sliced onions and cook until soft, translucent and lightly browned, stirring often. Add the sugar and continue stirring until the onions are deep brown in colour. This may take around 20 minutes. Add flour and cook for 3 minutes. Add water and bonox and simmer for 30 minutes. Top each slice of the baguette with a tablespoon of parmesan cheese. Toast baguette under a hot grill until golden brown. Serve baguette on top of the soup, and sprinkle with chopped parsley.

Place mahi mahi fillets in a ziploc bag and let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes. Spray non-stick baking pan with cooking spray. Place fish in pan. Drain juice from pineapple, reserve. Combine pineapple juice with curry powder and pour over fish. Add pineapple chunks and pepper slices on top of fish. Wrap pan tightly with foil. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees, then uncover and bake for 5 minutes more, until fish flakes easily with fork.
Add honey, cinnamon, sugar, tea, bourbon, ice, mint sprig. Serve over crushed ice. Garnish with mint leaves.

Heat oven to 350f degrees. Spray a small ovenproof dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place the brie in this dish. Spread sour cream over brie as though frosting a cake. Sprinkle top with brown sugar, then with pecans. Dot top with butter. Bake until cheese is very soft to the touch, 15-18 minutes. Increase heat to 425f and bake 5 minutes longer. Brie will be starting to melt on the bottom and the sugar will be bubbling on the top. Serve with bread, sliced apples and crackers.

In a large serving bowl put the lettuce, carrots, feta cheese, cherry tomatoes and saute for about 3 minutes. Add the remaining vegetables and continue cooking until they are done to your taste. Grind some fresh black pepper over all and stir well. Place in serving platter and sprinkle a small amount of grated parmesan cheese over all.

In a blender, combine the first five ingredients. Cover and process until smooth. Gradually add ice, blending until slushy. Pour into chilled glasses. Garnish with whipped topping, chocolate syrup and cherries.
Cook on low 6 hrs or high 4 hours.

Add all ingredients to a bowl and stir to combine. Use immediately or store in an air-tight container for later use. To use, sprinkle a generous amount of the dry rub over meat or fish. Pat the rub into the surface of the meat to help it adhere. Grill the coated meat over an open flame or add to a hot, well oiled skillet.

Heat oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees f. Rinse fish, pat dry, and season with salt and pepper. Combine flour, garlic powder, paprika, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 teaspoons pepper. Stir egg into dry ingredients. Gradually mix in one beer until a thin batter is formed. You should be able to see the fish through the batter after it has been dipped. Dip fish fillets into the batter, then drop one at a time into hot oil. Fry fish, turning once, until both sides are golden brown. Drain on paper towels, and serve warm.

Mix flour, baking powder, sugar, eggs, butter, milk, raisins, vanillapreparation:Mix just until all flour is moistened. Roll out dough onto lightly floured surface with rolling pin. Roll out to about 2 inch thickness. Use a round cookie cutter or the top of a glass to cut out buns. Put them into a 13x9-inch baking pan. Place them all together, no need to separate them. Bake at 450f until golden brown about 12-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Put broccoli, garlic salt and pepper in a bag and toss. Place in casserole dish and top with cheddar cheese. Cover and bake for 20 minutes.

Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in heavy skillet. Add beef and brown. Sprinkle with flour and cook an additional minute. Add water, wine, soup mix and bouillon and stir. Transfer to casserole dish with lid and bake at 325f for 3 hours. Ensure it does not go dry by adding wine or water. Fry mushrooms in pan with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add mushrooms to mixture and return to oven for an hour. Cook noodles as directed. Remove mixture from oven and stir in sour cream. Serve over noodles.
Add in the vodka, lime juice, sugar, soda water, blue curacao, green creme de menthe. Shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Pour into the glass. Add in the sprite to the glass. Shake vigorously for 5-

Preheat oven to 180dc. Heat oil in a heavy based pan, add onions, apples and ginger and cook until soft. Add mustard seeds and water and cook for 15 minutes. Remove mixture to warmed ovenproof dish. Deglaze pan with cider and add to onion mixture. Fry sausages in pan until browned. Drain and add to onion mixture. Bake in oven, uncovered for 25-30 mins. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Heat oil in a heavy skillet over high heat. Add garlic and turn steaks to coat. Season with salt& pepper, and cayenne pepper. Fry steaks until brown on both sides, turning once, about 4 minutes. Transfer to plates and serve. You can grill if you prefer.
Bake skewers for 10 minutes, or until cooked.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add coconut oil, jumbo shrimp, green onion, amaretto liqueur, coconut milk, heavy cream, sugar, coconut extract, vanilla extract. Cook for 3 minutes then turn shrimp. Add coconut oil, jumbo shrimp,

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lightly grease 13-by-9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Unroll beef cubes, onion, garlic cloves, diced tomatoes, water-packed artichoke hearts, fresh basil, salt, olive oil, parmesan cheese. Cover with drained tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and mushrooms. Sprinkle with feta cheese and sliced bell pepper. Bake for about 20 minutes until crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place roast in a large roasting pan. Combine soup mix, broth and beer in a bowl and stir until soup mix is dissolved. Pour over roast and place onions around it. Bake for 2 to 3 hours, basting frequently, or until beef is tender and looks stringy when pulled with a fork. If roast starts getting too crispy, cover pan with foil or lid. Slice meat thinly and serve on rolls. Serve juices in individual cups or bowls to dip sandwiches into.

Heat olive oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic and coriander and cook until fragrant. Add spinach and cook until there is no more pink. Add lentils, chicken broth, and bay leaves. Cover and bring to a boil, turn down heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add potatoes and cook for 15-20 minutes. When potatoes are soft add spinach and stir until completely wilted. Add olives and spinach. Add spinach and cook for 15-20 minutes. When potatoes are soft add olives and spinach. Cover and bring to a boil, turn down heat and simmer for

Combine kasseri cheese, butter, brandy, lemon, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy, lemon juice, brandy,

Mix together the meatballs, breadcrumbs, basil, pepper, salt, dried onion flakes, tomato soup, pineapple tidbits, brown sugar, green peppers. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes, or until the meatballs are crisp. Remove from oven and pour off the fat. Place the meatballs in a large flat baking dish so that the over lapping bacon is on bottom. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes, or until the

Heat 2 tbsp oil. Add onions and garlic. Saut until onions are tender. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, teriyaki sauce and ham. Let sit 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally. The less you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. The

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine olive oil, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper in large bowl. Add potato slices and turn them until throughly coated with the dressing. Arrange in baking dish, slightly overlapping each slice. Place in the oven and bake for 60 minutes until golden crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray non-stick spray in cassarole pan. Cook pasta and drain. Heat oil in deep skillet. Add onion & bell pepper. Cook and stir for a few minutes. Add pasta, chicken, tomatoes, olives, italian seasoniong. Mix to blend. Put mozzarella on top. Cook in oven for about 35 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Spread turkey on top of potato roll. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until hot through and bubbly.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Cook ham steak in skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Remove ham from skillet and keep warm. Squeeze lemon over pan, scraping up brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Add butter to pan. Once butter is melted, add garlic, parsley and tomatoes. Cook over medium heat for approximately 5 minutes, or until tomatoes soften and begin to lose their shape. Spoon sauce over ham steak and serve immediately.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate until serving. Garnish with blueberries and strawberries, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Brown ground beef. Drain. Mix ground beef with salsa, taco seasoning, and salad dressing. Mix well. In a 2-quart baking dish, layer half of the meat mixture, 1 cup of cheese and 1 cup of the tortilla chips. Repeat the layers. Bake, covered, for 30-40 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking. Top with lettuce and tomato before serving.

Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Whisk until smooth. Store in a glass container or jar in the refrigerator for up to 1 week and also freezes well. To make scrambled eggs. Fry slowly over low heat in a nonstick frypan.

Mix everything together in a slow cooker except chicken. Lay chicken on top and cover. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. 30 minutes before serving, remove chicken and shred. Return chicken to slow cooker and stir together. Top with cheese, sour cream, or tortilla chips, if desired.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon. Seal and marinate in refrigerator 20 minutes. Prepare grill or broiler. Remove salmon from bag, reserving the marinade. Place salmon on a grill rack or broiler pan coated with cooking spray, and cook for 6 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste salmon occasionally with the reserved marinade.

Heat the oil in a saucepan or stockpot. Add the onion and thyme. Saut until the onion is soft, but not brown. Add the tomatoes and stir briefly. Add the garlic and stir for about 3 minutes, or until the garlic is fully incorporated into the mixture. Stir in the sugar, chicken stock, and tomato paste. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Puree the soup mixture in a food processor and return ro the pot. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Just before serving, add the basil. Serve with a dollop of yogurt, if desired.

Mix strawberry, baby spinach, brie cheese, dijon mustard, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, balsamic vinegar, honey, bals

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and pesto. Add cream cheese and stir or whisk well until fully melted. Stir parmesan cheese until melted. Add cream and stir well.
Place ham in deep baking dish. Spread marmalade over marmalade pressing it down by hand. Bake 45 minutes till golden brown.
Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend until blended. Pour into a glass. Put cinnamon on top of the poured smoothie.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Peel and trim carrots and slice lengthwise into thin halves or quarters. Toss carrots in bowl with olive oil, rosemary and salt. Roast at 350 for 30 minutes, stirring half way through. Turn up oven to 425 and roast ten minutes longer or until the ends of the carrots begin to turn black. When carrots are almost done, melt apricot jam in microwave for 15-30 seconds. Remove carrots from oven, place in bowl and toss warm carrots with melted apricot jam. Toss with a little more rosemary if desired.

In a saucepan over high heat, bring the broth to a boil. Add the chicken, carrots, peas and scallions. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes, or until the carrots are tender. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. Serve, or freeze for later.

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.

Heat dressing in large saucepan on medium heat. Add onions. Cook 10 minute or until golden brown, stirring frequently. Add broth, 2 soup cans water and worcestershire sauce. Stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 5 minute. Preheat broiler. Ladle soup evenly into 4 large ovenproof bowls. Top with croutons and cheese. Broil 2 to 3 minute or until cheese is melted.

In a small saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. Add lemon peel and lemon juice, stir and remove from heat. Let cool completely, then strain into a clean pitcher. In a blender, puree the pint of strawberries and add to the lemon juice. Stir well and refrigerate. Add sparkling water and stir well when ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread sausage links, potatoes and peas in 13 x 9 baking dish. In saucepan over medium heat mix rest of ingredients until boullion cube is dissolved. Pour over sausage, potatoes and peas. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in 350 degree oven 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spread the vegetables in a single layer in one or more large shallow roasting pans. Do not crowd them or they will not brown. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Stir well. Roast the vegetables, stirring once or twice, for 45 minutes. Place the sausages on top of the vegetables. Bake for 15 to 30 minutes, or until the sausages and vegetables are cooked through. Serve hot.

In a large heavy saucepan combine the first 4 ingredients. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until the dutch barley is tender. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pretzel chicken in baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and whisk together until well blended and smooth. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake chicken with sauce mixture for about 20 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. For best results turn chicken over half way through cooking.

Preheat oven to 425f. You will need a 12-inch cast iron skillet, or oven-proof skillet, and a blender. In a blender at medium speed, mix together the eggs, milk, flour, granulated sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, until just combined, about 15 seconds. The batter should be a little bit lumpy. Melt the butter or margarine in a 12-inch cast iron skillet by putting it in the hot oven for about 30 seconds. Remove the skillet from the oven, spread the butter to coat the bottom and sides of the skillet, and pour in the batter. Return the skillet to the center oven rack and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the pancake is puffed and lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine eggs, corn syrup, apple, butter, vanilla extract, salt, ground cinnamon, macadamia nuts, nestl toll house butterscotch flavored morsels, unbaked 9-inch pie shellpreparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine eggs, corn syrup, apple, butter, vanilla extract, salt and cinnamon in large bowl. Mix well. Stir in nuts and morsels. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until edge is set but center still moves slightly. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Arrange the potatoes and the red and green potatoes alternately in a spoke pattern in a shallow, 12-inch round baking dish. Pile the onions in the center. Scatter the garlic over the top. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with rosemary, salt and black pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are lightly golden and tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

Saute mushrooms and beef roast in butter. Add mushrooms and butter. Add broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth, broth
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour, or until cheese on top is melted and golden brown.

Boil syrup and sugar together for about 2 minutes. Pour over eggs gradually, stirring well. Add butter, vanilla and pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake in preheated 375 oven for about 50 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350f. Fill 2 mini muffin tins with paper cups and spray with cooking spray. Place 1 key lime cooler cookie in the bottom of the cup, flat side down. Beat together cream cheese, egg, sugar, lime juice and zest until well mixed. Fill the cups to the top. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove tarts to cool. When completely cool, top with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine flour and brown sugar in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Press into bottom of an ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Top with pecans. Drizzle warmed caramel topping evenly over pecans. Bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes or until caramel is bubbly. Place on wire rack. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Let stand 5 minutes, then spread chocolate chips over caramel-pecan layer. Cool for at least 6 hours at room temp or until chocolate has set. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel onions, and cut in half crosswise. Place onions cut sides down, in an 8-inch square pan. Drizzle with water. Cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Combine honey and remaining ingredients. Turn onions over. Brush half of honey mixture over onions

In a large bowl, combine cabbage, white vinegar, sugar, pickling salt, boiling water, sauerkraut, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt, pickling salt,

Fry bacon in skillet. Set bacon aside. Reserve two tbs bacon drippings, turn heat down,. Drain bacon drippings, add to skillet along with the green pepper. Allow to cook until pepper is tender, about 5 minutes on med heat. Beat eggs and pour over panama mixture in skillet. Stir until eggs are just set. Crumble bacon and add to mixture. Sprinkle cheese on top.

Combine all ingredients except steak in a 13x9x2 inch glass baking dish. Add steak and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least two hours, turning occasionally. Preheat grill or broiler to medium high heat. Remove meat from marinade and discard marinade. Grill steak to desired doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer steak to work surface and let stand 5 minutes. Cut across grain into thin strips. Arrange on a platter and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. If frozen, partially thaw fillets and cut into serving size pieces. Place in a greased baking dish. Combine sour cream or yogurt, mustard, onion, dill, and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper. Spread mixture over fish. Bake 20 minutes per inch of thickness of fish if frozen or 10-12 minutes if thawed. When just done, sprinkle with the cheeses and a dash of paprika. Broil 1 minute or until the cheese is bubbly and flecked with brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Mix together cola, fresh ginger, brown sugar, lemons, lemon juice, lemon balm leaves, sugar, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves, lemon balm leaves

Put all ingredients in a stand mixer with a wire whip attachment and whip until butter is lighter in color and the volume has increased. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Or, dish it out on parchment paper and roll into a log. Wrap in plastic wrap and foil and it can be frozen for months. Best part is you can just unwrap and slice off what you need and rewrap it and stick it back in the freezer.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake for 15 minutes in 400 degree oven. Then pour mixture of beaten eggs and heavy cream over top. Bake for 30 minutes longer in 400 degree oven.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celsius. Cut bread into 1. 5 cm thick slices but do not cut all the way through. Place oil, lemon rind, garlic, herbs, salt and pepper into a bowl. Mix well, brush over both sides of each slice of bread. Wrap bread tightly in foil. Place on baking tray. Bake 20 - 25 minutes or till hot. Slice all the way through and serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl, combine almonds, breadcrumbs, walnuts, fresh apricots, granulated sugar, egg yolks, vanilla extract, unbaked 9-inch pie crustpreparation:Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl, combine almonds

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Cut off wedges, halve lengthwise, seeded and sliced into 1 inch half moons. In a small saucepan, combine maple syrup and sage, bring to simmer, reduce heat to low, cover and cook 15 minutes, set aside, covered. In a bowl, toss wedges with olive oil and salt. Transfer to a a foil lined baking sheet in a single layer, bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Pour maple syrup mixture evenly on top of wedges, halve lengthwise, seeded and sliced into 1 inch half moons. Transfer to a a a foil lined baking sheet in a single layer, bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Pour

Preheat oven to 200 degree celsius. Mix eggs and sugar until thick and creamy. Combine cornflour, milk and vanilla essence and slowly add to egg and sugar mix beating as you do so. Spoon mixture into pastry shell and sprinkle with ground nutmeg. Bake at 200 degree celsius for 10 minutes, reduce heat to 180 degree celsius and bake for a further 20 to 25 minutes. Skewer inserted at centre should come out clean.

Place all the ingredients in a bowl. Beat until combined well. Pour into a greased flan dish. Bake for about one hour at 175 degrees celsius. When baked it will surprisingly have a base, a custard centre, and a coconut topping.

Spray a bundt pan or an angel food cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place the rolls in the pan, sprinkle the whole package of butterscotch pudding mix over the rolls, sprinkle the brown sugar over the pudding mix, pour the butter over the brown sugar, and top with the pecans. Cover and place in the refrigerator overnight, or let rise for 4-5 hours before baking. Preheat oven to 350. Bake the rolls for 20-25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine the first 4 ingredients. In a 2-quart saucepan, heat the honey, oil and vanilla until syrupy. Add to the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread on a jellyroll pan. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Store in a covered container.

In a large skillet, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels then crumble. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper the, brown in the bacon drippings for about 5 minutes on each side. Place the breasts in a 4-6-quart slow cooker. Sprinkle with mushrooms. In the same skillet heat the soup and parmesan cheese with onions and garlic for 5 minutes until bubbly, then pour over the chicken and mushrooms. Cover and cook on low setting for about 4 hours. After about 4 hours sprinkle with the cheese cubes and bacon. Cover and cook on high for about 20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

In a 4-quart dutch oven cook potatoes in enough boiling water to cover for 20 to 25 minues or until just tender. Drain. Cool slightly. Peel and coarsely shred or finely chop potatoes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl stir together sour cream, soup, cheese, melted butter, onion, salt and pepper. Gently stir in potatoes. Transfer to greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Uncover, bake about 15 minutes more until golden.

Cook noodles according to package directions, or until of desired consistency, drain. Meanwhile, in a large pot combine all remaining ingredients. Stir in pork ribs, garlic, onion, tamarind soup mix, water, bok choy, daikon radish, tomatoes, potatoes, saltpreparation:Cook noodles according to package directions, or until of desired consistency, drain. Stir in pork ribs, garlic, onion, tamarind soup mix, water, bok choy, daikon radish, tomatoes, potatoes, saltpreparation:Cook noodles according to package directions, or until of desired consistency

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large saucepan, melt the butter. Add the brown sugar, cinnamon and pecans and mix well. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Add the sweet potatoes and stir until it is well blended and the sweet potatoes blends inches. Once it is well blended, add the pecans and stir. Pour this mixture over the potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in dish. Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle dry cake mix over cherries, then spread pecans over cake mix. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oil in an ovenproof skillet pan over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and garlic and sauti until shrimp start to turn pink. Add remaining ingredients. Transfer skillet to oven and cook until shrimp are fully cooked, about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Remove pork from marinade -save marinade. Heat oil in a skillet and saute the pork over medium high heat for 3 minutes, flip and continue cooking for another 3 minutes or until the pork is nicely browned on both sides. Pour in the marinade cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. Pour in the marinade cook

Place the roast on the roast. Put the worchester or 57 sauce on the roast. Open the condensed soups and add them over the top of the roast. You can use an extra can of the soup for more gravy for putting over rice or potatoes. Slow cook for 8-10 hours. Serve with yellow rice or whole grain rice and i promise it will be a feast for your family with almost no effort. It tastes much better and is much less expensive than going out to eat after church or work.

Whip egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tarter and salt. Whip until stiff and dry. Fold in chocolate chips, crushed candy canes, nuts, and vanilla. Drop by spoonfuls onto heavy brown paper. Bake at 300 degrees until the meringue sets. Cool. Remove from brown paper.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus and cook, stirring, until just tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add asparagus and cook, stirring, until just

Let butter soften to room temperature. Beat in other ingredients. Pack butter into molds or crocks or form balls with a melon baller. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Can be stored for upto 1 month in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms, and season with salt, if desired. Saute mushrooms 10 minutes or until beginning to brown. Add garlic and saute 2 minutes more. Sir in white wine and simmer until vinegar is almost evaporated, stirring to scrape up browned bits from pan. Drain wheat berries and add to mushroom mixture with vegetable broth and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 20 minutes. Add kale, and cook 10-20 minutes more, or until kale is tender. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Stir in rice. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover and turn heat down to low. Simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray muffin tin with cooking spray. Press a slice of ham into each muffin cup. Evenly distribute spinach between muffin cups. Evenly distribute cheese between muffin cups. Crack 1 egg to each muffin cup. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 25 min or until done.

Heat oil in nonstick sauce pan. Add chickpeas, onion, long-grain rice, water, saffron, olive oil, tomato puree, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper. Cover, reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in chickpeas, onion, long-grain rice, water, saffron, olive oil, tomato puree, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper. Cover, reduce heat and

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the collard greens and saute until wilted but still retain their bright colour, about 3-4 minutes. Add the vinegar, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt and black pepper to taste and toss well. Transfer to a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately.

Wash the spinach well and cut as finely as possible. Clean onions and cut into fine strips. Put onions into a saucepan with the oil and cook til softened. Add dill and cook a bit longer. Add the spinach, salt and pepper, add 3 c water and the rice. Cover the saucepan and allow to boil. Just before spinach is fully cooked, add in 3 more cups water and the rice. Just

Heat oven to 350 f. In a large saucepan, over medium heat, bring 2 cups of the milk and the corn to a boil. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining milk and the cornmeal. Whisking constantly, slowly add the mixture to the boiling milk. Reduce heat and simmer gently, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the butter, thyme, salt, pepper and eggs. Transfer to a buttered casserole or cast-iron skillet. Bake until golden and set, about 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line muffin pan with foil baking cups. Cut plum amarettinis into 16 pieces and pat into a round disc. In mixer cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs then add baking powder, soda and extract. Fold in 1 cup flour, buttermilk then remaining flour until well blended. Spoon about 2 tablespoons batter into each cup and smooth surface. Top with level teaspoonful of preserves, then the piece of plum amarettini. Top each muffin with another 2 tablespoons of batter. Bake 25 minutes or until lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Heat broth, soy ginger glaze, pickled ginger, sesame seeds, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger, pickled ginger

Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, saltines, and garlic together and form into 2 loaves. Bake covered at 350 degress fahrenheit in stoneware for 45 to 75 minutes. Drain grease. For the sauce, combine tomato sauce, brown sugar, mustard, worcestershire sauce. Pour sauce over loaves. Cover meatloaf and cook 15 minutes. Remove cover and cook 10 to 15 minutes. To freeze, just freeze the meat mixture in meal size portions. Thaw it in the refrigerator for a day before cooking. You could make and freeze the sauce too, but i usually mix it up when i cook the meat.

Sprinkle olive oil, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic, onion, garlic

Heat grill to high. Melt butter in a frying pan and fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute. Toast the bread, top with the mushrooms and then the cheese. Grill until cheese is brown and bubbly.

Mix together peanut butter, honey, mayonnaise, bananas, lemon juice, lettuce, peanuts. In a separate bowl, mix peanut butter, honey, mayonnaise, bananas, lemon juice, lettuce, peanuts. Spread the peanut butter over the top of the salad. Spread the peanut

In a two-quart bowl, mix the first 4 ingredients together. Fold the beaten egg whites in until all are well mixed. Pour into unbaked pie shell of 9inch pan. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. When taken from oven, filling will seem a little shaky, but when cooled, will be creamy. Prep time does not include making pie crust.
Preheat waffle iron and coat with cooking spray. Cook waffles in waffle iron.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute spinach in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. For sauce combine soup, mayo, lemon juice and curry powder in a bowl. In bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish layer frozen broccoli, chicken, and sauce. Sprinkle with grated cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Can be eaten plain or on top of rice.

Place potatoes and garlic in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Mix seasonings in small bowl. Coat pork skins evenly with the rub. Refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 3 hours for extra flavor. Grill over medium heat 25 to 30 minutes or until desired doneness, turning occasionally. Let pork stand 5 minutes before cutting into thin slices. Test kitchen.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add pineapple juice, concentrates and extract. Cover and freeze. Remove from the freezer 1-2 hours before serving. Just before serving, mash the mixture with a potato masher and stir in lemon-lime soda.

Combine butter, cream cheese, caraway seed, pickled capers, dijon mustard, paprika, anchovy fillet. Bake at 425 for 7 to 10 minutes or until spread has melted and is a light golden brown. To serve, slice diagonally.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place pizza crust on pizza stone or baking sheet, sprinkle with cheese and thyme. Top this with onion mixture, then mushrooms. Cook for about 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute tomatoes, onion, chile sauce, green onion, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Stir in potatoes and cook until heated through. Spoon potato mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish and sprinkle with cheese. Serve when the cheese has melted.

In a bowl, combine chicken broth, cornstarch, mustard and dill weed. Mix well and set aside. Heat butter in large skillet. Saute chicken and onion until lightly browned. Slowly add chicken broth to chicken, stirring constantly over medium heat, bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until slightly thickened. Pour chicken mixture over hot cooked noodles and toss, serve.

Preheat the oven to 375f heat the vegetable oil in a small ovenproof frying pan. Fry the chicken wings for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden. Remove the pan from the heat and add the soy sauce, water and honey. Transfer to the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes, turning the chicken wings once. Arrange the chicken wings on a warmed platter, scatter over the sesame seeds and serve.

Heat oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add pepper-and-onion mixture and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Add thinly sliced beef and cook with the pepper mix another 5 minutes set aside and keep warm. For cheese sauce, melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add flour, whisking constantly until bubbly, about 1 minute. Slowly whisk in milk until thickened, about 3 minutes. Stir in black pepper, cheese, chipotle peppers, and adobo sauce. Divide steaks and pepper-and-onion mixture among 4 baguette slices. Top with cheese sauce and remaining 4 bread slices.

In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and salt, blending well. Slowly add milk, stirring constantly. Cook until mixture boils and thickens. Set aside press tomatoes through a sieve or blend until smooth. In a soup pot, combine remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer 10 minutes. Pour white sauce into soup, stirring constantly. Heat thoroughly before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. In large mixing bowl, combine flour, white sugar, baking soda, eggs, crushed pineapple with juice, brown sugar, nuts, vanilla, evaporated milk, butter. Mix well. Pour mixture into an ungreased 9x13 pan. Sprinkle brown sugar and chopped nuts over cake batter. Bake for 30 minutes. Ten minutes before cake is done, start making the frosting. Combine all frosting ingredients in a medium size sauce pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat slightly and let boil for 5 minutes. Pour frosting on cake as soon as it comes out of the oven. Serve cake cool or warm. Top with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl. The dough should form a ball -- not too dry, but not too sticky either. If you have mixed for a long time, and there is still a lot of flour in the bowl, add a tiny bit more water. If the dough is too wet, add more flour. Cover the ball of dough with a thin dusting of flour, so you can remove it from the bowl. Using floured hands, spread the dough onto a greased cookie sheet -- the dough should be thin enough cover the entire sheet. Bake for 25 minutes at 350. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool, and cut into 12 slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Arrange apple slices in the bottom of a prepared 9x12 baking dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Dot with butter. Top apples with seared pork chops. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour cranberry juice over all and cover. Bake for 1 hour. Make sure pork reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees f.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl. The dough should form a ball -- not too dry, but not too sticky either. If you have mixed for a long time, and there is still a lot of flour in the bowl, add a tiny bit more water. If the dough is too wet, add more flour. Cover the ball of dough with a thin dusting of flour, so you can remove it from the bowl. Using floured hands, spread the dough onto a greased cookie sheet -- the dough should be thin enough cover the entire sheet. Bake for 25 minutes at 375. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool, and cut into 12 slices.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all ingredients on a large greased baking sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Roast in preheated oven for about 50 minutes, turning once during cooking, until potatoes are tender. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375f. In bowl, combine apples, orange juice, white sugar, butter, cornstarch, brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans. Blend well and spread in the bottom of a ungreased 8 or 9 inch round cake pan. Separate dough into 4 rectangles, firmly press perforations to seal. In small bowl combine sugar and cinnamon, sprinkle mixture evenly over rectangles. Sprinkle 1 t of pecans on each rectangle. Starting at shorter side, roll up each rectangle and pinch edges to seal. Cut each roll into 4 slices. Place cut side down, over brown sugar mixture in pan. Bake at 375f for 20 to 27 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 1 minute, invert onto serving platter or foil.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in saut pan. Saut apple slices until just turning soft. Beat together eggs, cream or milk, and salt & pepper until blended but not frothy. Melt remaining butter in omelet pan over high heat until foam begins to recede but before beginning to color. Pour in egg mixture and prepare omelet, stirring lightly, but allowing it to set on the bottom. Fill with sauted apples and brie. Fold or roll and slide out of pan onto a heated plate.

Mix all ingredients for the base and put into greased 8x8 pan. Spread ice cream squares over base. Mix the topping together well and spread over ice cream squares. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

In a small saucepan, mix sugar and cornstarch then whisk in soda until smooth. Bring to a boil and cook while stirring for 1 minute or until thickened. Cover and refrigerate until cool. In a large bowl, combine the grapes, cream cheese, blue grapes, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, toothpick, and salt and pepper to taste. Add the plums to a serving platter. Sprinkle with the croutons and serve hot.

Heat oil in a wok until very hot. Stir fry celery ribs for 2 to 3 minutes. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and saut on medium heat adding cup of water can help steam the vegetables. Cover pan for about 2 minutes. Cover for 1 to 2 minutes. Then uncover and saut until done ideally 1 more minute to keep veggies crisp. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 grease lagrge casserole dish. Cook gnocchi according to directions. Drain. Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. Add tomatoes and seasoning. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add gnocchi to spinach mixture in skillet, stir gently. Transfer gnocchi mixture to prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake 20-30 minutes or until bubbly and sheese is melted. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream brown sugar and melted butter. Add vanilla and eggs 1 at a time. In a separate bowl, sift flour, powder, and salt. Add dry mixture into wet mixture. Spread into a greased glass baking dish. Cook in oven until golden, 15-18 minutes. In a microwave safe bowl, heat peanut butter and cream on low heat. Stir in vanilla and eggs 1 at a time. Cook

Place noodles, chicken broth, onion, soy sauce, bok choy, corned beef, oil in slow cooker. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove noodles, cover, set to high heat and cook for 20 minutes. Remove chicken broth, cover, set to high heat and cook for 20 minutes. Remove chicken broth

Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl combine flour, cheese, sugar, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, milk, canola oil, egg, self-rising flour, shredded cheddar cheese, margarine. In a medium bowl, add milk, oil, and egg, mixing well. Stir into wet bowl into dry bowl, until moistened. Pour into a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 f for 50 to 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted near centre comes out clean. When you remove from oven, spread margarine over top with paper towel. Cool for 10 minutes in pan. Remove to wire rack and cool for 10 more minutes, then enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Combine all gravy ingredients except flour. Shape into patties and dredge in flour. Brown patties in oil in heated skillet over medium high heat. Remove from skillet. Combine all gravy ingredients in a bowl, mixing well with a whisk. Pour into skillet, stirring constantly until thickened. Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Can also add a little more seasoned salt. Place patties into gravy and turn to coat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until done.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all ingredients on a large greased baking sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Roast in preheated oven for about 50 minutes, turning once during cooking, until potatoes are tender. Serves 6.

In a 3 quart saucepan, melt butter and saute onions. Add potatoes, water, and bouillon cubes. Cover and bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Cook just until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, place frozen broccoli and cheddar cheese in crock pot on low to start melting and thawing. Once the potatoes are done, using a hand blender, blend contents of saucepan to desired consistency and then pour into the crock pot. Heat on low until warmed.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook pasta in boiling water until just al dente. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet. Cook until fragrant. Add remaining ingredients except pasta. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta. Add to sauce and cook, stirring, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and serve.
Heat oil at medium-high in large skillet. Add pork chops and cook until browned. Set aside.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the turnips. Add the turnips to the pan with the garlic. Cover the pan and cook over low heat till the turnips are tender
